alert.note: Alert for Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 8:46PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, Sanford, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, Casselberry, Lake Mary, Longwood, Lake Jessup, Geneva, Goldenrod, Osteen, Fern Park, Maytown, Sanford Airport, Mullet Lake Park, Lake Monroe, Central Florida Zoo and Lake Harney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
